intro: Lasianthus idukkianus, commonly known as the Idukki lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and undergrowth. It is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
